attendingChurchFrequency: ﻿[visited] once in two months [by] Rev. Theod. J. Vanden Broek

affiliated: ﻿Served by a Seminary of Liguorists, 5 in No.

NOTES: ﻿https://www.jstor.org/stable/1892625?seq=14 , p 398 ; this source gives credit to the almanac's timeline of it opening in the late 30s.
courses: ﻿The course of instruction pursued in the College will embrace the Latin, Greek, French and English languages, Poetry, Rhetoric and Oratory, Reading, Writing, Geography, Mathematics and Book-Keeping. A favorable opportunity to become well conversant with the French language, will be found in the intercourse with the pupils whose native tongue is French. Strict attention will be paid to the moral conduct of the students, and no infraction of the disciplinary rules of the College will be connived at; in case of delinquency, the delinquent will first be admonished, and if admonition, or if mild and paternal punishments prove ineffectual, he will be sent back to his parents or guardians.
